content: Compose a poem about spring using only words that start with 'b'.

Blossoming branches bear bright buds,
Birds build busy nests in boughs.
Breezes bring balmy breath,
Beneath blue skies, blooms abound.

Butterflies bathe in blooming blooms,
Bees busily buzz between blossoms.
Brooks babble bubbly broods,
Bridges border babbling waters.

Books of botany boast boundless beauty,
Berries burst with bold colors.
Bushes bear blue and black berries,
Blending beautifully in the breeze.

Spring's bounty bestows boundless bliss,
Bringing back beauty each brand new year.
